greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q * phi(-q) * psi(q^8) / (phi(q) * phi(q^4)) in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q * (f(-q) * f(-q^16) / (f(q) * f(q^4)))^2 = q * (chi(-q^2) * chi(-q^4) / (chi(q) * chi(-q^8))^2)^2 in powers of q where chi(), f() are Ramanujan theta functions.
Expansion of (eta(q) * eta(q^4) * eta(q^16))^4 / (eta(q^2) * eta(q^8))^6 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (16 t)) = f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
a(n) = -(-1)^n * A215348(n). a(2*n) = -4 * A107035(n). Convolution inverse of A214035.
mathematica: a[n_]:= SeriesCoefficient[(EllipticTheta[3, 0, -q]*EllipticTheta[2, 0, q^4]/(EllipticTheta[3, 0, q]*EllipticTheta[3, 0, q^4]))/2, {q, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n,1,50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 07 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<1, 0, n--; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^16 + A))^4 / (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^8 + A))^6, n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Aug 08 2012
